definitions.definition: To remove a connection to ground potential.
examples: If you unground the extension cord it will cause a shock hazard in that drill.

definitions.definition: To free from the punishment of being grounded (restricted to home).
examples: We'll consider ungrounding you when you can act your age.

main_definition: ( transitive , electricity , electronics ) To remove a connection to ground potential.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To free from the punishment of being grounded (restricted to home).
